title: Leveraging GNSS and Onboard Visual Data from Consumer Vehicles for Robust Road Network Estimation
abstract: arXiv:2408.01640v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Maps are essential for diverse applications, such as vehicle navigation and autonomous robotics. Both require spatial models for effective route planning and localization. This paper addresses the challenge of road graph construction for autonomous vehicles. Despite recent advances, creating a road graph remains labor-intensive and has yet to achieve full automation. The goal of this paper is to generate such graphs automatically and accurately. Modern cars are equipped with onboard sensors used for today's advanced driver assistance systems like lane keeping. We propose using global navigation satellite system (GNSS) traces and basic image data acquired from these standard sensors in consumer vehicles to estimate road-level maps with minimal effort. tldr: 该文章提出了一种利用车载GNSS和普通车辆传感器收集的图像数据自动构建道路网络的方法，通过将问题转化为基于卷积神经网络的道路中心线语义分割任务，最小化了对人工干预的需求，使道路图的自动生成成为可能。
